author: Rainer Winkler
description:
By some technique, in cases where a distance high enough for connvection cannot be acchieved, the air gap between PPE and clothing or skind shall be as small as possible. 

This may reduce the effective outer surface of the PPE, so it should be assessed whether this really increases the total heat transfer.

This is not an innovative idea, but fast and cheap to implement, so I post it here. Even if a new cooling technique is invented, it will work better if all other possible actions are performed.
summary: Air has a high heat resistance. By reducing the thickness of this layers, the heat can easier be transfered to the outside of the PPE.
title: Reduce isolating air layers in PPE
